summary: Barbara J. Robinson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. The documents list her name, social security number, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The specific role or responsibilities of Barbara J. Robinson within the SCAS are not detailed in these documents, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member during the committee's investigation.
significance: Barbara J. Robinson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While her specific role is not detailed, her presence on the payroll contributes to the overall record of the committee's staffing and operations.
